thread.title: LTFRB okays P8 minimum fare for jeepneys in Metro, Regions 3 & 4
thread.title_full: LTFRB okays P8 minimum fare for jeepneys in Metro, Regions 3 & 4

author: cbibe
title: LTFRB okays P8 minimum fare for jeepneys in Metro, Regions 3 & 4

organizations.name: land transportation franchising and regulatory board

text:
By: Yuji Vincent Gonzales - Reporter / @YGonzalesINQ INQUIRER.net / 01:05   Starting Wednesday, Feb. 8, 2017, the minimum fare in Metro Manila, Central Luzon and the Southern Tagalog region will already be P8. On Monday, the LTFRB approved a provisional P1 hike in the minimum fare in the three regions amid rising fuel costs. INQUIRER.NET 
The Land Transportation Franchising and Regulatory Board (LTFRB) has approved a provisional one-peso fare hike for public utility jeepneys in Metro Manila and Regions III and IV. 
LTFRB chair Martin Delgra made the announcement on Monday, making the minimum fare for PUJs P8 in the covered areas. 
Delgra said the hike would be implemented starting on Wednesday, Feb. 8. ADVERTISEMENT 
The hike stemmed from a petition filed by the Alliance of Concerned Transport Organization (ACTO) last year. With reports from Jovic Yee, Philippine Daily Inquirer/CBB
